Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Situation2: They see a group of teenagers ignoring the no-diving signs near the pool edge.
Story: I sat beside Alex on the sun-warmed bench, our hands intertwined, trying to savor every second of his last weekend before he moved abroad. He looked at me with that soft, searching gaze, and I knew he wanted these hours to be just about us—no distractions, no interruptions. But as I leaned in, laughter and splashing caught my attention. Across the pool, a group of teenagers was daring each other to dive right under the bold red “NO DIVING” signs. My lifeguard instincts kicked in, heart pounding with the familiar surge of responsibility. I was supposed to keep everyone safe, to enforce the rules, no exceptions. But if I left Alex now, even for a moment, I’d be breaking the promise I made to make this day special for him. I could feel the weight of both roles pressing down on me, my mind racing between duty and love, torn by the impossible choice I had to make.
